alert.note: Alert for Adams; Claiborne; Copiah; Franklin; Jefferson; Lincoln (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 12 at 7:30AM CDT until March 12 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Claiborne County in southwestern Mississippi... Northwestern Lincoln County in south central Mississippi... Eastern Jefferson County in southwestern Mississippi... Franklin County in southwestern Mississippi... East central Adams County in southwestern Mississippi... Copiah County in central Mississippi... * Until 830 AM CDT. * At 730 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hermanville to Fayette to near Natchez, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Carpenter around 735 AM CDT. Blue Hill around 740 AM CDT. Dentville and Stampley around 745 AM CDT. Union Church, Hamburg, New Hope and Pleasant Hill around 750 AM CDT. Glancy around 755 AM CDT. Crystal Springs, Hazlehurst, Kirby, Gallman, Mccall Creek and Caseyville around 800 AM CDT. Martinsville around 805 AM CDT. Bude, Vaughn, West Lincoln and Loyd Star around 810 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Roxie, Meadville, Beauregard and Georgetown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Claiborne; Copiah; Franklin; Jefferson; Lincoln
